cyclone.name: HERMINE
cyclone.current_location: about 345 miles W of Key West, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: forecast to turn NNW tonight and then NNE toward the northeast Gulf coast of Florida
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend coast between the Anclote River and Indian Pass

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch from Anclote River to Indian Pass FL; Tropical Storm Watch west of Indian Pass to the Walton/Bay County line
weather_observation.warning_coast: None in effect (only watches issued so far)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Gulf Coast, especially the Big Bend region; tropical-storm-force wind field may extend westward to the FL/AL border
weather_observation.first_hazard: None expected at Plaquemines Port District, LA
weather_observation.wind: Breezy conditions possible, but the chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds is only 3%
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected for Plaquemines Parish; surge threat is confined to Florida Big Bend
weather_observation.rainfall: Only scattered showers expected; heavy core rainfall remains well east of Louisiana
weather_observation.other_hazards: None anticipated that would significantly disrupt port operations
